title: What would happen if you didn't sleep?
description: In the United States, it's estimated that 30 percent of adults and 66 percent of adolescents are regularly sleep-deprived. This isn't just a minor inconvenience: staying awake can cause serious bodily harm. Claudia Aguirre shows what happens to your body and brain when you skip sleep. [Directed by TED-Ed, narrated by Addison Anderson, music by Carlos Palomares].
author: Claudia Aguirre
keywords: TED, talks, TED-Ed, sleep, brain, biology, science, human body, youth, physiology, health, health care, public health, healthcare, education, memory
